A survey system for freelance graphic designer
text:
I am Kevin Lu, a 12-year-experience graphic designer from Taiwan. I studied graphic design in the BFA program back at San Jose State University.

After years as a freelance graphic designer, I noticed that most of my clients couldn't distinguish a good design from a better one! I interviewed my clients, and 90% of them told me the only way they could identify a designer professional or not wasn't by their work but by their project management and communication abilities.

That was the A-ha moment in my graphic design career because most freelance graphic designers were not good at managing projects, designing, and sales simultaneously. It would help many freelance designers if I built a project management tool specifically for them!

Freelance designers usually spend at least five meetings to confirm a design direction; we automate the process through survey templates. Projects may fail or delay if they don't grab clients' intention accurately and fast enough. Our survey system allows freelance designers to be more productive, leading to client satisfaction and sales!

I invite you to sign up at https://service.dotbrand.design/users/signup and give us feedback!

The invitation code: kevinvite1

Ask HN: How to get into top tech companies during this hiring slowdown?
text:
Just heard back from Microsoft, apparently they are not moving forward with any new grad applications as all roles were filled by return offers to interns.

I interned at a fairly large tech company this summer, but I don't want to go back to work for them. I'm graduating next year.

I'm having a really hard time with new grad applications this cycle. Does anyone have any tips? Other things I can do to maximize my chances?
